intro: Caloscordum inutile, commonly known as the useless heart, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its distinctive umbel-shaped inflorescence. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Caloscordum inutile is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
